page.title: 16LOCAL CUSTOMS & TRADITIONS
page.content:
Each year the town has a{Civic Week}in which all local organisations take a part. These have included the staging of a{ Hiring Fair}with farm lads and servant girls being hired for the next half year as in times past.Stalls sell traditional dulse and yellow man.
Other traditions are associated with the commemoration of the{Battle of the {Boyne.} Arches are built over some streets and bunting is put up. On the eve of the {Twelth of July }bonfires are lit in Antiville and other parts of the town. On the day itself members of the{Orange Order}leave to parade at a rally . The traditions of Hallowe'en are still practised mainly by younger children.
{ Paula Wilson
